iron.name: Iron
iron.description: Find iron ore in riverbeds with reddish stones (bog iron). Crush, wash out impurities, and use a clay furnace with charcoal to reduce oxides to metallic iron (bloom). Use stone hammers to forge tools.

carbon.name: Carbon
carbon.description: Make charcoal by stacking wood in a clay pit and limiting air. Light the wood and keep a smoldering burn for days. This charcoal serves as a high-heat fuel.

steel.name: Steel
steel.description: Steel is made by carburizing iron in simple furnaces. Under low-oxygen conditions, bury pieces of iron in charcoal and heat to infuse carbon. You can use clay molds to shape blades, tools and structural parts.

wood.name: Wood
wood.description: Harvest trees using stone axes. Split logs into planks for construction, or burn them for heat. Wood is versatile for building shelters, making tools, and creating fire.

stone.name: Stone
stone.description: Collect stones from riverbeds or cliffs. Use them for tools, weapons, and construction. Stone can be shaped with other stones to create sharp edges or used as a solid building material.

axe.name: Axe
axe.description: Craft an axe by attaching a sharp stone to a wooden handle. Use it for chopping wood, clearing paths, and building structures. An axe is essential for survival in the wilderness.

shovel.name: Shovel
shovel.description: Build a shovel by attaching a pointed stone to a wooden handle. Use it for digging, moving earth, and creating trenches. A shovel is useful for excavation and construction.
